programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Extended edition from April 2016 in which comedian and actress Tracey Ullman became the 100th guest host of the satirical current affairs quiz, with broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at that week's news.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave tests the merits of man versus machine, in all its life-like glory. Plus, he finds himself in a lucrative, but compromising situation.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz April 2016, with comedians Romesh Ranganathan and Eddie Izzard joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at that week's news stories.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: In 1850, a man wakes after a long illness and finds he is being cared for by strangers - but isn't allowed to leave. Read by Anna Friel.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: Beth is contacted by a shy girl who used her image on a dating site, and now wants Beth to meet her new beau.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: A baritone sells his soul to the devil to ensure his barbershop quartet wins a competition. Doc Brown reads this twisted tale, set in 1940s New York.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster Chris Tarrant continues his travels along the world's most challenging railways. Here he attempts to cross the Andes, setting off from the coast of Chile and heading for the Bolivian capital of Sucre. Along the way he traverses some of the driest and most inhospitable environments on the planet, hitches rides on unusual trains and deals with altitude sickness at more than 3,000 metres.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How in devising the F35 Lightnin II, engineers have pushed the boundaries of aviation technology further than ever before and created a brand new, revolutionary, fighter aircraft capable of handling threats in the air and on the ground. Plus, Rob Collings flies one of the most successful aircraft of the Second World War, the distinctive P38, former RAF test pilot Andy Edgell tracks down the product of a top secret research project, the X-14 and retired US Air Force pilot Mace Carpenter reconnects with the stealthy F117.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A policewoman is murdered, and when a blood-soaked shoe is found in a suspect's wardrobe, it seems to be an open-and-shut case - but Kavanagh is not convinced the right man is in the dock. John Thaw stars.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The widow of a rich merchant stirs up a tempest of lust as the men of Shrewsbury vie for her hand in marriage - and it seems one has no qualms about murdering all his rivals. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Michael Culver and Julian Firth.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Patricia Routledge stars as Lancashire housewife Hetty Wainthropp, a part-time Post Office worker with a sideline in sleuthing. In this first episode, the mysterious death of a pensioner leaves a few unanswered questions, but Hetty smells a rat and with her young assistant Geoffrey, sets about solving the mystery the police have little interest in. Drama, also starring Dominic Monaghan and David Benfield.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Live Boxing
programme.desc: Brad Foster v Lucien Reid. Coverage of the rematch for the British and Commonwealth Super Bantamweight titles, which takes place at the York Hall in London's Bethnal Green. The fighters shared the spoils in a majority draw when they met here five months ago, with one judge giving Reid the nod and the other two scoring it even. This time around both men will be determined to maintain their unbeaten record and ensure there is a decisive outcome in their favour.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: The contestants are guaranteed some fine food today as their mystery host is celebrity chef Aldo Zilli. Can he cook up enough cryptic clues to hide his Italian identity or will he be getting out the Fairy Liquid when the diners have all gone home? Brian McFadden plays go-between.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: That's So 90s: The Guys
programme.desc: It's time to rewind and look back at some of our favourite 90s songs from the guys.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Bushmen Rod and Les risk their lives re-opening a long-abandoned mine. New team the Young Guns goes deep underground for the first time, hunting pineapple opal.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce purchases a Second World War army uniform for Â£40,000 when hunting for paratrooper gear, while Hus almost throws up when doing loops in a Mustang.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: The Truckers have a tight deadline moving four huge army Viking vehicles over 200km. However, loading and securing 12.5 tons onto their trailers is not going to be easy.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: On the Road - European Tour: Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The crew members continue their European holiday by meeting actor and fellow motorcycle fan Ewan McGregor. They also lead the annual Brighton Burn-Up rally.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Joe pushes Fantomworks off the deep end when he challenges them to build a replica of a legendary 1953 hydroplane that set a water speed record with an automotive engine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer gets his hands on a valuable 1995 Ford Escort RS Cosworth, hoping new mechanic Ant Anstead can restore the 227hp engine's famous 'fizz'.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of chocolate coins, pedal cars and latex swords.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of motorcycle jackets, shovels and spades, and the production of farmed caviar.

programme.title: Charles Manson: The Final Words
programme.desc: Documentary combining the final interviews with the cult leader prior to his death with personal accounts from former followers to uncover the reasons behind the infamous murders.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.sub-title: Thomas Lee Dillon: The Silent Sniper
programme.desc: Examining the case of Thomas Lee Dillon, a serial sniper who killed people in Ohio for three years before police finally caught him.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Walsenburg, Colorado, in which a frantic emergency telephone call to help a neighbour ended in a bizarre investigation, complete with a twisted tale of torture and family secrets.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of New Jersey state trooper Phillip Lamanco, whose killers were connected to terrorism.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Rescuing young animals injured or placed in difficulties through neglect and their own curiosity.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: A cat is brought into the clinic soon after giving birth, could there be another kitten on the way? Plus, Alison and Audrey check out some lumps on a golden retriever.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: All brides have a tight budget, forcing some to haggle for even more bang for their buck. It remains to be seen whether everyone will be able to secure their dream dress.
